CatDescriptText: Mr.  Andrew Johnson, clothing store employee, East Liberty and Miss Diana Davis, college student, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 7, 1962, pg. 7 with question: "Do you agree with the Supreme Court's decision against prayer in public schools?"  Mr. Johnson's answer reads: "To a certain extent, as part of the separation of state and church.  However, I go along with the idea of students saying a silent prayer before classes, each according to his own denomination."  Ms. Davis' answer reads: "No, I don't agree.  A prayer is a good way to start off the day."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Andrew Johnson wearing plaid button down collared shirt and sunglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Diana Davis wearing sunglasses, four strand beaded necklace, and striped dress, standing in front of Thrift Drugs store, May Building, Fifth Avenue, Downtown
